OFFADD: 1249 S. Vinnell Way, SUITE 200 Boise ID 83709
SUBJECT: SWAUGER CREEK ROAD ERFO PROJECT 2019 No. 2
CONTACT: KAREN L. MORTHLAND, CONTRACTING OFFICER, Phone 2083734115, Email KMORTHLAND@FS.FED.US - TROY JORGENSON, ENGINEER, Email TROY.JORGENSON@USDA.GOV
DESC:
SWAUGER CREEK ROAD ERFO PROJECT 2019 No. 2

REPLACES 12-0261-19-Q-0016
The intent of the contract is to provide for the complete construction of the project described in the contract. Unless otherwise provided, the Contractor shall furnish all labor, materials, equipment, tools, transportation, and supplies and perform all work required to complete the project in accordance with drawings, specifications, and provisions of the contract.

This project proposes to repair a road slough by placement of 165' of rock buttress shoulder repair and 135' of deep patch repair. This includes excavation of existing roadway material, stockpiling suitable material for use in repair, disposal of unsuitable material, placement of drain rock, geotextile, unclassified borrow, and class 6 riprap.

LOCATION AND DESCRIPTION
From Bridgeport, California, proceed north on Highway 395 for approximately 10 miles, Swauger Creek Road is on the right. Project is located approximately 2.5 miles north of the junction of Highway 395 and Swauger Creek Road.

CONTACT TROY JORGENSON TROY.JORGENSON@USDA.GOV FOR MORE INFORMATION

ESTIMATED PRICE RANGE - Between $100K - $250K

CONTRACT TIME WILL BE 30 days with an estimated start date of August 15, 2019.

NAICS Code: 237310 Size Standard: $36.5 This proposed procurement is a TOTAL SMALL BUSINESS set aside.

SUBJECT: Vertical Launching System (VLS) Launch Sequencer (LSEQ) Production
CONTACT: Jason Tsao, Contract Specialist, Email jason.tsao@navy.mil - Michael D. Thompson, Contracting Officer, Email michael.d.thompson4@navy.mil
DESC:
Naval Surface Warfare Center Port Hueneme Division (NSWC PHD) intends to issue a solicitation for the manufacture, assembly, test and delivery of Vertical Launching System (VLS) Launch Sequencer (LSEQ) MK Mod 2, Part Number 7104340-29.  Sources Sought Notice No. N6339419R0017 posted to FBO.gov on 18 March 2019 provides additional information regarding the requirement.

Based on the market research results, the Government has determined that this requirement will be solicited under the provisions of FAR Subpart 6.1 Full and Open Competition under NAICS 334519, pursuant to the policies and procedures of FAR Part 15 Contract by Negotiation.  The activity small business office concurs with the set aside determination.

Disclaimer: This presolicitation notice is for information only and shall not be construed as a commitment by the Government to solicit contractual offers or award contracts.  The Government is not soliciting, nor will it accept, proposals as a result of this synopsis.  If a competitive solicitation is issued in the future, it will be announced via FBO.gov and interested parties must comply with that announcement.  The Government will not reimburse respondents for any questions submitted or information provided as a result of this notice.  This is not a solicitation or a promise to issue a solicitation, and this information is subject to modification and in no way binds the Government to award a contract.

SUBJECT: P5P6 Flowmeters
CONTACT: Dyer, Rachel
DESC:
This is a Sources Sought announcement for an upcoming Request for Proposal (RFP) requirement. All eligible and qualified contractors may submit capability statements and past resumes for similar work for consideration. The capability statements received will be reviewed to determine the quantity and availability of contractors who have the required experience, technical level of expertise, administrative and management capability to manage the services described below. A solicitation will be issued in the next 60-90 days. 
The Bureau of Reclamation plans on issuing a contract for work located at Grand Coulee Dam, adjacent to the cities of Grand Coulee and Coulee Dam, Washington, approximately 90 miles west of Spokane, Washington, in Grant County. The principal components of the work include installing flowmeters for John W. Keys III Pump-Generating Plan P5 and P6 discharge tubes. 
To be considered capable and qualified to perform these services, a contractor must show a performance history that demonstrates an established service provider network, qualified personnel, supervision and equipment and any other items required to accomplish the required services.
The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code for this acquisition is 334513 – Instruments and Related Products Manufacturing for Measuring, Displaying and Controlling Industrial Process Variables. The small business size standard for NAICS Code 334513 is 750 Employees. If an offeror feels that there is a more suitable NAICS Code classification for this item, please indicate when submitting your capability package.
Interested contractor's may submit capability packages that include the following information: (1) Firm's name, address, telephone and fax numbers, business size and type: Women-Owned Small Business, (8)(a), HUB Zone, Service Disabled Veteran, Small Business, Large Business, etc.), Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business and point of contact to include e-mail address and telephone number; (2) Demonstration of the firm's previous experience (as a prime contractor or a subcontractor) in the construction of detailed work in second paragraph. Contractors should submit a list of past projects that were similar in scope and complexity to the requirement referenced in this announcement. Offeror shall provide the project title, location, and detailed descriptions of the effort and how it was similar, the project's dollar value, contract award number, completion dates, and the customer's name and telephone number. (3) Companies DUNS Number and (4) Capability statements are to be submitted not later than 3:00 P.M. Local Time on May 20, 2019. All responses to this Sources Sought notice shall be provided to Bureau of Reclamation, Rachel Dyer, Contract Specialist –via e-mail at rdyer@usbr.gov. Call Rachel Dyer at 208-378-5110 if you have any questions. 
When it is determined that a formal solicitation will be issued, a pre-solicitation notice will be posted on Federal Business Opportunities web site at http://www.fedbizopps.

SUBJECT: Ivanti Endpoint Manager - Brand Name or Equal Procurement
CONTACT: Michael C. Hagerty, Contracts Specialist, Phone 7573968354, Email michael.hagerty@dla.mil
DESC:
This announcement constitutes a Sources Sought Notice. It is neither a request for quote (RFQ) nor a request for proposal (RFP). Responses are voluntary and the Government will not pay for any cost incurred in responding. This announcement is for market research and planning purposes only. The result will contribute to determining the method of procurement. The requirement may be set-aside for small businesses (in full or in part) or procured through full and open competition. All small business set-aside categories will be considered. The anticipated NAICS Code is 334614, with a small business size standard of 1250 employees. Telephone inquiries will not be accepted or acknowledged. No feedback or evaluations will be provided to companies regarding submissions.

The Defense Logistics Agency, DLA Maritime Norfolk, seeks to procure, on a brand name or equal basis, the Ivanti Endpoint Manager software, support services, and training. Contract will be awarded as a Firm Fixed Price with delivery of FOB Destination to the Norfolk Naval Shipyard, Portsmouth, VA.

This acquisition will be Brand Name or Equal; line items for procurement are as follows:

01) Endpoint Manager, Qty 4000 Licenses (See Attachment 1 salient characteristics)
02) Endpoint Manager Services, Qty 1 Lot (See Attachments 2A and 2B salient characteristics)
03) Endpoint Manager Training, Qty 2 Lots (See Attachment 3 salient characteristics)

Vendors that elect to respond to this sources sought notice should provide the following information at a minimum:

1. Company name and summary of core competencies. Include the relevant company point(s) of contact (name, title, telephone number, and email address).
2. Company CAGE Code and DUNS number to verify your business status.
3. Small business size status, e.g., small, 8(a), WOSB, EDWOSB, SDVOSB, etc.
4. Any Federal contract vehicle(s), such as GSA Schedules or DOD ESI contracts, that your company holds which could be used to procure these items. Provide: contract #, agency office name that issued your contract, applicable SIN codes, and contract period of performance
5. Which line items your company would be able to supply/provide.
6. Recommended delivery schedule for the order in its entirety.
7. Any comments or questions regarding this notice or the attached salient characteristics. Answers to contractor questions will not be provided at this time, however the questions posed may assist the Government in understanding potential issues or challenges. Answers to contractor questions will likely be provided as appropriate after the Solicitation has been issued.
8. Whether or not your company has in place a signed/certified DD2345 related to the US/Canada Joint Certification Program. If so, provide the Certification Number and Expiration Date.
9. Supply up to 3 reference contracts and short descriptions, which are similar to the product identified in this sources sought.

Elaborate responses are neither desired nor required. Submittal shall be no longer than five (5) pages in one (1) pdf file. Email responses shall be sent to Michael.Hagerty@dla.mil not later than 4 pm ET, 10 May 2019. Please mark your information "Proprietary", as you believe appropriate. Please ensure that the Purchase Requisition (PR) number N4215890948640 is included in the subject line of any email correspondence. Emails without subject lines will not be read due to security issues. Thank you in advance for your participation.

SUBJECT: Vertical Launching System Launch Sequencer MK 5
CONTACT: Jason Tsao, Contract Specialist, Phone 8052287146, Email jason.tsao@navy.mil - Michael D. Thompson, Contracting Officer, Email michael.d.thompson4@navy.mil
DESC:
This is a Request for Information (RFI) as defined in FAR 15.201 (e). Naval Surface Warfare Center, Port Hueneme Division (NSWC PHD) is conducting market research to identify qualified and responsible sources that may be interested in a potential future procurement for the manufacture, assembly, test and delivery of Vertical Launching System Launch Sequencer MK 5 Mod 2, Part Number 7104340-29.

This RFI is issued for informational and planning purposes only and does not constitute an Invitation for Bid, Request for Quote, or Request for Proposal. This RFI is not to be construed as a commitment by the Government to issue a solicitation or award a contract. In accordance with FAR 15.201(e), responses to this notice are not offers and cannot be accepted by the Government to form a binding contract. As such, the Government will not reimburse any costs associated with responding to this notice. Information submitted in response to this RFI will become the property of the United States Government.

Responses to this RFI may be used to determine Small Business set-aside opportunities. All Small Business set-aside categories will be considered under North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code 334519 Other Measuring and Controlling Device Manufacturing. In accordance with FAR 52.219-14, Limitations on Subcontracting, Small Business concerns are reminded that in performance of contracts awarded under small business set-aside procedures, at least 50% of the cost of manufacturing the supplies, not including the cost of materials, shall be performed by the concern.

Interested parties shall address the following in their RFI submissions:

1. COMPANY INFORMATION

(a) Company name, address, Data Universal Number System (DUNS) number, and Commercial and Government Entity (CAGE) code.

(b) Company designated representative name(s) and point(s) of contact, including phone number and email address.

(c) Company size status under the applicable NAICS (e.g., 8(a), HUBZone, Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned, Women-Owned, Large Business, etc.).

2. CAPABILITY STATEMENT

Interested parties shall submit a Capability Statement that succinctly addresses the following items to demonstrate the contractor's capability to perform the requirements of the attached draft Statement of Work (SOW):

(a) The contractor's ability to manage, as prime contractor, the types and magnitude of tasking in the draft SOW;

(b) The contractor's technical ability, or potential approach to achieving technical ability, to perform the requirement. For Small Business set-aside determination purposes, also include the contractor's technical ability to perform, or potential approach to achieving technical ability to perform, at least 50% of the cost of the contract incurred for manufacturing the supplies, not including the cost of materials; and

(c) The contractor's capacity, or potential approach to achieving capacity, to conduct the requirements of the draft SOW. For the purposes of this Capability Statement, capacity shall refer to matters such as the magnitude of the tasking, the amount of equipment or facilities involved, and the size of the staff needed.

(d) The contractor's certification, or potential approach to achieving certification, for International Organization for Standardization (ISO) 9001:2015, 2008 or AS9100D.

Demonstrated ability to manage, technical ability, and capacity may include citing and describing the same or similar relevant performance, but does not limit the interested contractor's approach to demonstrate capability.

3. FEEDBACK/QUESTIONS

(a) Feedback and questions regarding the feasibility or challenges to perform the work described.

RFI responses are limited to no more than 20 pages (8.5 X 11 inch) and 10-point Times New Roman font. Please email responses or questions regarding this requirement to the Contract Specialist, Jason Tsao (jason.tsao@navy.mil) with copy to the Contracting Officer, Michael Thompson (michael.d.thompson4@navy.mil). NSWC PHD may request further information regarding the capabilities of respondents to meet the requirements set forth in the RFI.

Respondents are responsible for properly marking and clearly identifying proprietary information or trade secrets contained within their response. The Government will not be liable for, or suffer any consequential damages for any proprietary information not properly marked and clearly identified. Information provided shall be treated as Business Sensitive and will not be shared outside of Government activities and agencies without the permission of the provider.

AGENCY: Department of Health and Human Services
SUBJECT: Network Equipment
CONTACT: Brendon C. Moran, Contract Specialist , Email brendon.moran@ihs.gov - Paul B. Premoe, Contracting Officer, Email paul.premoe@ihs.gov
DESC:
(i) This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items, prepared in accordance with the format in subpart 12.6 of the FAR and as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a separate written solicitation will not be issued.

(ii) Solicitation number 75H70419Q00047 applies, and is issued as a Request for Quote (RFQ).

(iii) This solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular 2019-02, effective June 5th, 2019.

(iv) This requirement is a total Indian Small Business Economic Enterprise (ISBEE) set-aside and the associated NAICS is 334118 with small business size standard of 1,250 employees.

Non-ISBEE offerors will not be considered for the award.

(v) The Contract Line Items (CLINs) structure is as shown below.

CLIN 0001: Cisco CS-ROOM55-K9, 2 EA, Unit Price tiny_mce_marker_____, Total Price $ ______
CLIN 0002: Cisco C9410R-96U-BNDL-A, 4 EA, Unit Price tiny_mce_marker_____, Total Price $ ______
CLIN 0003: Cisco AIR-CT3504-K9, 4 EA, Unit Price tiny_mce_marker_____, Total Price $ ______
CLIN 0004: Cisco AIR-AP2802I-BK910, 4 EA, Unit Price tiny_mce_marker_____, Total Price $ ______
CLIN 0005: Cisco R-ISE-VMS-K9, 4 EA, Unit Price tiny_mce_marker_____, Total Price $ ______
CLIN 0006: Cisco ISE-BSE-PLS-APX, 4 EA, Unit Price tiny_mce_marker_____, Total Price $ ______
CLIN 0007: Cisco ISR4331-V/K9, 2 EA, Unit Price tiny_mce_marker_____, Total Price $ ______
CLIN 0008: Cisco CP-7821-K9, 43 EA, Unit Price tiny_mce_marker_____, Total Price $ ______
CLIN 0009: Cisco CUWL-11X-K9, 54 EA, Unit Price tiny_mce_marker_____, Total Price $ ______

*See the attached scope and Bill of Materials (BOM) attachments for additional details. The CLINs listed above represent the primary equipment, while the attached BOM details supplemental information/requirements for each CLIN listed above. Please note that pricing provided must be inclusive of all items listed in the attached BOM.
Total $ ____________

(vi) The purpose of this acquisition is to purchase a list of network and related equipment for multiple Indian Health Service facility locations. This is a Brand Name Only requirement. Only manufacture certified original and new equipment shall be quoted.

(vii) Delivery and acceptance terms for this order are FOB Destination, with delivery required 30 days ARO. Delivery Addresses: Indian Health Service, 33100 County Road 31, Davis, CA 95616; Indian Health Service, 650 Capitol Mall, Suite 7-100, Sacramento, CA 95814; and Indian Health Service, 1270 Kot-Num Road, Warm Springs, OR 97761.

*See the attached scope for additional details.

(viii) The provision at 52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors - Commercial Items (Jan 2017) applies to this acquisition.

(ix) 52.212-2, Evaluation - The award will be made to the lowest priced technically acceptable offeror. Acceptable Business Quote shall include a completed Table A which can be found under the attached Scope, Section 11 - Equipment Required/Contract Line Item Numbers (CLINs). To be considered for the award, the offeror shall provide a reseller/partnership certification that evidences the company's eligibility and capability to provide the requested Cisco equipment (e.g. Cisco Partner documentation). Furthermore, the offeror shall conform to the following requirements in the quotation: only manufacture certified original and new equipment shall be quoted; no grey market or refurbished equipment shall be quoted; all optics and cables must be vendor certified original and new; no third party or compatible optics and cables shall be quoted; and Only Cisco approved maintenance coverage is to be quoted (if applicable). No partial awards will be made.

(x) Offerors shall include a completed copy of the provision at 52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications -- Commercial Items, with its offer.

(xi) FAR 52.212-4 Contract Terms and Conditions - Commercial Items (Jan 2017) applies to this acquisition. The following addendum applies: Email Addresses for submission of invoices are brendon.moran@ihs.gov, COR'S, and HQInvoices@ihs.gov.

L. 113-235) and its successor provisions in subsequent appropriations acts (and as extended in continuing resolutions)).

DESC:
The proposed contract action is for commercial supplies or services for which the Government intends to solicit and negotiate with only one source under the authority of FAR 13.501(a)(1)(ii). Interested persons may identify their interest and capability to respond to the requirement or submit proposals. This notice of intent is not a request for competitive proposals. However, all bids, proposals, or quotations received by the closing response date will be considered by the Government. A determination by the Government not to compete with this proposed contract based upon responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government. Information received will normally be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement. 

This is a sole source solicitation action to BrandSafway Services, Inc., the HAKI® manufacturer’s exclusive North American contracting partner and distributor, in accordance with the attached Justification and Approval (J&A).

DESC:
This solicitation is ready to be issued as of this date. The Embassy of the United States in Bangkok, Thailand, has launched the solicitation on the FebBizOpps website. This solicitation is for Gardening Services for the USAGM Thailand Transmitting Station. The resultant contract will be a firm fixed price contract for standard services, for one base year with two one-year options.
This solicitation has been issued via FedBizOpps - no paper copies will be mailed. All responsible sources may submit an offer, which shall be considered, but electronic submissions will not be accepted.

There will be a pre-quotation conference and a site visit on June 25, 2019 at 10:30 hrs. (Thailand local time) at USAGM Udornthani Station.  The proposal due date will be set forth in the solicitation.

The Government encourages offers to register with the System for Award Management (SAM) in advance of the quotations submission pursuant to FAR provision 52.204-7.

The Government intends to award a contract resulting from this solicitation to the lowest priced technically acceptable offeror who is a responsible contractor. The Government may award the contract based on initial offer without discussion.

USAGM Thailand Transmitting Station, Bandung District.
Udornthani
